Reason: The 'row_cache_save_period' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can have a significant impact on system performance. This configuration determines how often the row cache is saved to disk, affecting memory consumption and disk I/O operations. A lower value may increase memory usage but reduce disk I/O, while a higher value may decrease memory usage but increase disk I/O, leading to notable variations in system performance.
